analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal gyis zhum pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pas chos ston par byed do //

analyzed: / phan pa dang bde ba nyid de snying brtse ba'o //

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

translated: Giving to one who is not a wrong livelihood is giving to one who is not a wrong livelihood.ğŸ”½Giving to one

analyzed: yang dus thams cad du sbyin pa zhes bya ba'i phyug pa'i dus dang dbul ba'i dus thams cad du sbyin pa zhes bya ba'o // dpyas dang bcas pa'i dngos po'i sbyin pa ma yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Again, at all times means at all times of wealth and poverty called generosity.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sbyin pa nyid do //ğŸ”½'du ba'i sgor gyur pa'i sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sbyin pa nyid do // 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa'i sbyin pa ni /
translated: The generosity of things free from reproach is called generosity free from reproach, or generosity free from defilement.

original: dngos po thams cad sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The generosity of things that are doors of assembly is called generosity of all things.

original: 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa ni zhing gi dngos po la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa ni zhing gi dngos po la sogs pa'o // gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The doors of assembly are things like fields, houses, etc.ğŸ”½ For what reason is it called generosity of things that are doors of assembly?

original: yul gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said: because of the thing of the object.

original: 'du ba'i nor dang 'bru'am de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du ba'i nor dang 'bru'am de la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wealth of assembly is grain, etc.

original: la la nas ni sems can gyi dngos po thams cad sbyin pa zhes 'don te /
analyzed: la la nas ni sems can gyi dngos po thams cad sbyin pa zhes 'don te /
translated: Some read generosity of all things of sentient beings,

original: de lta na ni sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po sbyin pa nyid kyang 'don par 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po sbyin pa nyid kyang 'don par 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but if that were so, it would follow that the generosity of things that are not sentient beings would not be included.

original: phongs pa dang 'dod pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa @147a * //
analyzed: phongs pa dang 'dod pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa @147a * //
translated: The needy and the desirous are the needy and the desirous.

original: ste 'dod pa nyid ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ste 'dod pa nyid ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The desirous are those who are desirous of something.

original: de la sbyin pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa la sbyin pa ste /
translated: Giving to the needy and the desirous is giving to the needy and the desirous.

original: phongs pa bsal ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa spang ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phongs pa bsal ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa spang ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called giving to the needy because it removes their poverty, and it is called giving to the desirous because it abandons their desire.

original: rgyan dang snod spyad 'dod pa nas byug pa 'dod pa'i bar ni 'dod pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: rgyan dang snod spyad 'dod pa nas byug pa 'dod pa'i bar ni 'dod pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: Giving to those who desire ornaments, vessels, perfumes, garlands, ointments, etc. is called giving to the desirous,

original: sems dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it delights the mind.

original: zas sbyin pa la sogs pa ni phongs pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zas sbyin pa la sogs pa ni phongs pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Giving food, etc. is called giving to the needy,

original: phongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phongs pa spong bar byed pa dang / sdug bsngal bzlog pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it removes their poverty, because it is a cause for the cessation of suffering, and because it nourishes.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa drug spang bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa drug spang bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya'o /
translated: Giving should be understood as eightfold, in order to abandon the six kinds of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa drug las bkres pa dang skom pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni phongs pa de bsal ba'i phyir bza' ba dang btung pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa drug las bkres pa dang skom pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal sel ba'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni phongs pa de bsal ba'i phyir bza' ba dang btung pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of food and drink in order to remove the suffering of hunger and thirst is called the giving of the removal of natural suffering.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is of two kinds:

original: bslangs pa dang / ma bslangs pa'o //
analyzed: bslangs pa dang / ma bslangs pa'o //
translated: given without being asked for and given after being asked for.

original: de la ma bslangs pa ni bkres pa dang skom pas yongs su gdungs pa mthong nas ma bslangs par rang gis ster ba ste /
analyzed: de la ma bslangs pa ni bkres pa dang skom pas yongs su gdungs pa mthong nas ma bslangs par rang gis ster ba ste /
translated: The giving without being asked for is when one sees someone suffering from hunger and thirst and gives food and drink without being asked.

original: de'i phyir ma bslangs pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bslangs pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Therefore, it is called the giving without being asked for.

original: 'dod pa rnams kyis bslangs nas byin pa ni bslangs pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams kyis bslangs nas byin pa ni bslangs pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The giving after being asked for is when one gives food and drink after being asked by those who desire them.

original: de bzhin du bzhon pa la sogs pa la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzhon pa la sogs pa la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The giving of vehicles, etc. should be applied in the same way as appropriate.

original: lam du 'gro ba'i yan lag ma tshang bas sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba'i yan lag ma tshang bas sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of vehicles is in order to remove the suffering of those who are incomplete in their limbs while traveling on the road.

original: bgo ba med pa'i sdug bsngal ni gsang ba dgag pa dang bral ba rnams la de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir gos sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: bgo ba med pa'i sdug bsngal ni gsang ba dgag pa dang bral ba rnams la de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir gos sbyin par byed do //
translated: The suffering of being unclothed is the suffering of those who are without clothing to cover their private parts. The gift of clothing is given to remove that suffering.

original: 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal can rnams mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la de bsal ba'i phyir rgyan nas brtsams nas dri dang byug pa'i bar sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal can rnams mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la de bsal ba'i phyir rgyan nas brtsams nas dri dang byug pa'i bar sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: The suffering of being deprived of what one desires is the suffering of those who do not obtain the desired objects that they long for. The gift of ornaments, etc., up to perfumes and ointments is given to remove that suffering.

original: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i reg pa'i sdug bsngal brnag dka' ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brten te gnas sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba la sogs pa'i reg pa'i sdug bsngal brnag dka' ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brten te gnas sbyin par byed do //
translated: The suffering of being tormented by cold, heat, etc., is the suffering of those who are tormented by cold, heat, etc. The gift of a dwelling is given to remove that suffering.

original: 'gro 'ong la sogs pa'i tha snyad rgyun 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal can rnams la de bsal ba'i phyir snang ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'gro 'ong la sogs pa'i tha snyad rgyun 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal can rnams la de bsal ba'i phyir snang ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: The suffering of being deprived of the continuity of conventional usage is the suffering of those who are deprived of the continuity of conventional usage of going, coming, etc. The gift of light is given to remove that suffering.

original: de ltar 'di dag ni sbyin par bya ba'i rdzas kyi dbye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ni sbyin par bya ba'i rdzas kyi dbye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these are the eight types of gifts that are distinguished according to the different kinds of objects that are given.

original: len pa po rnams la 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du phan gdags par 'gyur @147b bas 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa po rnams la 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du phan gdags par 'gyur @147b bas 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called â€œgenerosity that brings happiness here and in the next worldâ€ because it benefits the receiver in this world and in the next world.

original: thams cad kyang bsdus nas gsum du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyang bsdus nas gsum du brjod par bya ste /
translated: All of these are included in three types of generosity.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa ni dngos po gtong bas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa ni dngos po gtong bas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Generosity of material things is distinguished by the giving of things.

original: lus nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It stabilizes the body.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni nyam da ba'i gnas nas skyob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni nyam da ba'i gnas nas skyob par byed pa ste /
translated: Generosity of fearlessness is distinguished by the giving of protection from fear.

original: srog nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It stabilizes life.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / nye bar bshad pas kha na ma tho ba med pa la sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni bstan pa dang / bshad pa dang / nye bar bshad pas kha na ma tho ba med pa la sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: Generosity of Dharma is distinguished by the giving of teachings, explanations, and instructions.

original: sems nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It stabilizes the mind.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pas phan 'dogs par byed pa mdor bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In brief, generosity of material things is taught in order to benefit others.

original: bzang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas na bzang po'o //
analyzed: bzang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kha dog la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pas na bzang po'o //
translated: The phrase good and so on refers to the excellence of color and so on.

original: de dag gis ni dbang po lnga'i sgo nas phan 'dogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dbang po lnga'i sgo nas phan 'dogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: These two lines indicate the benefit that is conferred by means of the five faculties.

original: mi gtsang ba'i dngos po dang ma 'dres pas na gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i dngos po dang ma 'dres pas na gtsang ba'o //
translated: The phrase pure means that it is not mixed with impure things.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir rung ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir rung ba'o //
translated: The phrase suitable means that it is free of any offense.

original: 'di gnyis kyis ni yid kyi sgo nas phan 'dogs par bstan to //ğŸ”½ser sna'i dri ma bsal ba'i phyir ni dngos po mchog sbyin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ni yid kyi sgo nas phan 'dogs par bstan to // ser sna'i dri ma bsal ba'i phyir ni dngos po mchog sbyin par bstan to //
translated: These two lines indicate the benefit that is conferred by means of the mind.ğŸ”½The phrase gives the best of things indicates the generosity that removes the stain of stinginess.

original: sog 'jog gi dri ma bsal ba'i phyir ni mang po sbyin par bstan to //
analyzed: sog 'jog gi dri ma bsal ba'i phyir ni mang po sbyin par bstan to //
translated: The phrase gives in abundance indicates the generosity that removes the stain of hoarding.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni slong ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub cing yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas yid kyi sgo nas phan btags par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni slong ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub cing yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas yid kyi sgo nas phan btags par bstan pa yin no //
translated: These two lines indicate the benefit that is conferred by means of the mind, because the petitioner's desired goal is accomplished and his or her hopes are fulfilled.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni 'di la bde ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni 'di la bde ba yin te /
translated: These five types of generosity are happiness for the bodhisattva in this life.

original: dbang po drug gi sgo nas ji ltar rigs par phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi sgo nas ji ltar rigs par phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they benefit others in whatever way is appropriate through the six sense bases.

original: ser sna'i dri ma ni sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa ste sbyin pa dang 'gal ba'o //ğŸ”½sog 'jog gi dri ma ni longs spyod kun du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna'i dri ma ni sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa ste sbyin pa dang 'gal ba'o // sog 'jog gi dri ma ni longs spyod kun du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The stain of miserliness is the mental grasping of things; it is the opposite of generosity.

original: bdag nyid la longs spyod pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la longs spyod pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: The stain of hoarding is the grasping of enjoyments; it is the opposite of enjoyment.

original: 'di dag gnyi ga yang sems can dman pa rnams kyi yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyi ga yang sems can dman pa rnams kyi yin gyi gzhan dag gi ni ma yin no //
translated: Both of these belong to inferior persons, not to others.

original: de'i phyir / dman pa'i 'jig rten zad pa'i 'jigs pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dman pa'i 'jig rten zad pa'i 'jigs pa yis //
translated: Therefore,

original: bdag nyid mi spyod gzhan la'ang sbyin mi byed //ğŸ”½ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi spyod gzhan la'ang sbyin mi byed // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: the inferior world does not enjoy itself, nor does it give to others,ğŸ”½out of fear of the loss of its hoard.

original: srog nyams pa'i 'jigs pa las bskyab pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: srog nyams pa'i 'jigs pa las bskyab pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The generosity of fearlessness is taught in order to protect from the fear of losing one's life:

original: seng ge dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: from lions, tigers, and so on, from kings, robbers, and so on, and from water, fire, and so on.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The generosity of Dharma is threefold:

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams don dang yi ge phyin ci ma log pa nyid du ston pa nyid dang / 'jig @148a * //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams don dang yi ge phyin ci ma log pa nyid du ston pa nyid dang / 'jig @148a * //
translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma of the Sutras, etc., without error as to the meaning and the words.ğŸ”½It is the proper teaching of all mundane crafts without transgression.

original: rten pa'i las thams cad kha na ma tho ba med par tshul bzhin du nye bar ston pa nyid dang / nyes par spyod pa las ldog pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rten pa'i las thams cad kha na ma tho ba med par tshul bzhin du nye bar ston pa nyid dang / nyes par spyod pa las ldog pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the engagement in and the undertaking of the avoidance of misconduct.

original: chos rnams kyi sbyin pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi sbyin pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of the Dharma is the giving of the Dharma.

original: chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma is twofold:

original: don 'dir ni bstan pa'i chos dang legs par spyad pa'i chos so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni bstan pa'i chos dang legs par spyad pa'i chos so //
translated: the Dharma of teaching and the Dharma of good conduct.

original: sems can gzhan dag la de dag gnyi ga nye bar sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la de dag gnyi ga nye bar sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas chos kyi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The giving of the Dharma is to be understood as the giving of both of these to other sentient beings.

original: de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus nas ji ltar bstan pa'i zang zing la sogs pa'i sbyin pa sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa dgus bsdus pa rnams ji ltar rigs par 'di dang gzhan du bde bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus nas ji ltar bstan pa'i zang zing la sogs pa'i sbyin pa sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa dgus bsdus pa rnams ji ltar rigs par 'di dang gzhan du bde bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: All of these are included in the generosity of material things, etc. , as previously explained, and are included in the nine aspects of generosity previously explained. They are taught here and elsewhere as conducive to happiness.

original: rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i dbye ba rnam pa lnga bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase along with their divisions refers to the fivefold division of the generosity of material things that was presented above.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa yang rnam pa lnga nyid de /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa yang rnam pa lnga nyid de /
translated: The generosity of freedom from fear is also fivefold.

original: seng ge la sogs pa'i dngos po las yongs su skyob pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge la sogs pa'i dngos po las yongs su skyob pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the protection of others from lions, etc.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum mam /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum mam /
translated: The generosity of the Dharma is threefold.

original: sngar bstan pa'i dbye bas rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i dbye bas rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or, it can be understood in detail through the analysis that was presented above.

original: rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu'i spros pa'i rnam pa ni mdo nas bstan pas 'dir ni mdor bsdus nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnam pa bcu'i spros pa'i rnam pa ni mdo nas bstan pas 'dir ni mdor bsdus nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The ten aspects of purity and the elaborations on them were presented in the sutra. Here, they are presented in brief.

original: sbyin pa'i bar du gcod pa ni mang du 'byung la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bar du gcod pa ni mang du 'byung la /
translated: There are many obstacles to generosity.

original: dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa yang rnyed par dka' bar shes nas myur du sbyin pa ni thogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa yang rnyed par dka' bar shes nas myur du sbyin pa ni thogs pa med pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity is unimpeded when one gives quickly, having understood that the perfection of the excellent human birth is difficult to obtain.

original: rkyen du byed pa de lta bur ni zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sbyin pa las brtsams te sems dga' bar 'gyur ba de ltar slong ba pos rnyed pa thob pas dga' bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen du byed pa de lta bur ni zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sbyin pa las brtsams te sems dga' bar 'gyur ba de ltar slong ba pos rnyed pa thob pas dga' bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase in the same way that refers to the fact that the petitioner does not experience the same joy from obtaining the gift that the bodhisattva experiences from giving the gift.

original: de'i sgo nas shin tu myur du ster bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas shin tu myur du ster bar rig par bya'o //

translated: Having generated a joyful mind means with a superior intention that is free of deceit, and with a mind that is supremely delighted, as indicated by the phrase with a mind that is supremely delighted.

original: bdag gis byas pa la ji ltar dga' ba de bzhin du gzhan gyis byas pa la yang rjes su yi rang zhing dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa la ji ltar dga' ba de bzhin du gzhan gyis byas pa la yang rjes su yi rang zhing dga' bar byed do //
translated: Just as one delights in what one has done oneself, so too one delights in what has been done by others.

original: bzod par byed ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi phyir gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bzod par byed ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi phyir gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: One forbears means that one does not harm others with one's body or speech.

original: / dge ba byas pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pas bsod nams tha dad pa skye bar 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed pa yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: / dge ba byas pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed pas bsod nams tha dad pa skye bar 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir yongs su sngo bar byed pa yin no zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the merit that is generated is distinct because the virtue that has been accomplished is dedicated to complete enlightenment, it says one dedicates.

original: smon lam chen po bcu sngon du 'gro ba'i yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: smon lam chen po bcu sngon du 'gro ba'i yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams 'debs pa yin no //
translated: One formulates the great prayers that are the true prayers that are preceded by the ten great aspirations.

original: dkon mchog mchod @153b pa ni mdor bsdu na zang zing gi mchod pa dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog mchod @153b pa ni mdor bsdu na zang zing gi mchod pa dang sgrub pa'i mchod pa ste /
translated: Worship of the Three Jewels is, in brief, worship with material goods and worship with spiritual practice.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad ces smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad ces smos so //
translated: Therefore, the word â€œallâ€ is mentioned.

original: mchod pa ngan pa dgag pa'i phyir rgya chen po zhes smos te /
analyzed: mchod pa ngan pa dgag pa'i phyir rgya chen po zhes smos te /
translated: In order to prevent inferior worship, the word â€œmagnificentâ€ is mentioned.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod pa ngan pa gtan du mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mchod pa ngan pa gtan du mi bya'o //
translated: Inferior worship is never performed by the bodhisattvas.

original: brtson zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor bas bsdus pa'i dge ba ston to //
analyzed: brtson zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor bas bsdus pa'i dge ba ston to //
translated: The words â€œdiligentâ€ and so on indicate the virtues that are included in the application to the perfections such as generosity.

original: bag yod par gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni brtson pa kho na ston to //
analyzed: bag yod par gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni brtson pa kho na ston to //
translated: The words â€œabiding in heedfulnessâ€ indicate the very diligence.

original: tshogs kyi lam gyi gnas dge ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam gyi gnas dge ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the virtues that are the stations of the path of accumulation, he says:

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œin the bases of the trainings,â€ and so on.

original: dran pas spyod par mi byed pa'i tshul gyis srung bar byed de /
analyzed: dran pas spyod par mi byed pa'i tshul gyis srung bar byed de /
translated: He guards them by the method of not letting them be lost through heedlessness.

original: shes bzhin gyis ni spyad par gyur kyang phyir gso ba'i tshul gyis kun nas srung bar byed do //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis ni spyad par gyur kyang phyir gso ba'i tshul gyis kun nas srung bar byed do //
translated: And even when he has engaged in them through lack of vigilance, he protects himself by means of the method of restoration.

original: 'di gnyis ni nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba dang byung ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba dang byung ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For these two are the antidotes to the non-arising and the arising of the passions.

original: bdag nyid la bdag byams pa med pas na bdag gi rgyud kyi 'khrul pa dang / nyes par spyod pa la nyes ba kho na rab tu shes pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bdag byams pa med pas na bdag gi rgyud kyi 'khrul pa dang / nyes par spyod pa la nyes ba kho na rab tu shes pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Since he has no self-love, he knows only the fault in the error and bad conduct of his own stream.

original: de yang tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i nyes dmigs mthong bas na nyes par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i nyes dmigs mthong bas na nyes par lta ba yin no //
translated: And since he sees the danger in this life and the next, he has a sense of shame.

original: yongs su shes shing nyes dmigs mthong nas tshul bzhin du yongs su spong pa'i phyir gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: yongs su shes shing nyes dmigs mthong nas tshul bzhin du yongs su spong pa'i phyir gtong bar byed do //
translated: Having understood and seen the danger, he gives them up through proper means.

original: 'khrul pa byung na yang nyes pa la nyes pa yin par 'chags par byed pa'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa 'chags pa'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa byung na yang nyes pa la nyes pa yin par 'chags par byed pa'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa 'chags pa'i gnas bstan to //
translated: And when error arises, he confesses the fault as a fault.

original: sgrub pa ni ma skyes pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni ma skyes pa skyed pa'o //
translated: Practice is the generation of what has not yet arisen.

original: srung ba ni skyes zin pa brjed mi ngas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba ni skyes zin pa brjed mi ngas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: Protection is the maintenance of what has already arisen through the method of non-forgetting.

original: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ni gnas pa la khyad par du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis rgya chen po dang 'phel ba dang / yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ni gnas pa la khyad par du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis rgya chen po dang 'phel ba dang / yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Increase is the expansion, growth, and inflation of the maintenance through the method of special progress.

original: sems can rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa bcu gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa bcu gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of living beings is established as elevenfold, from the viewpoint of three kinds of living beings.

original: sems can rnam pa gsum ni phongs pa rnams dang / zhugs pa rnams dang / zhe 'gras pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnam pa gsum ni phongs pa rnams dang / zhugs pa rnams dang / zhe 'gras pa rnams so //
translated: The three kinds of living beings are those who are in distress, those who are engaged in the Way, and those who are hostile.

original: phongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who are in distress are of two kinds:

original: phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa dang / phan 'dogs 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa dang / phan 'dogs 'dogs pa'o //
translated: those who are not helpful and those who are helpful.

original: de la phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis g-yen spyo ba rnams te /
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa ma yin pa ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyis g-yen spyo ba rnams te /
translated: Those who are not helpful are those who are despised because of the three kinds of suffering.

original: sems can gyi bya ba de dang de dag tu grogs med pa'i sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba de dag la grogs byed pa dang / nad kyi @154a * //ğŸ”½sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba rnams la nad g-yog ge sgo nas grogs byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don rnams la thabs mi shes pas rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis g-yen spyo ba rnams la spyir chos bstan pa sngon du gtong ba'i rigs pa ston pa dang /

translated: They help those sentient beings who are tormented by the suffering of being friendless in whatever their activities.ğŸ”½They help those who are tormented by the suffering of disease by nursing them.ğŸ”½They help those who are tormented by the suffering of confusion, not knowing the means for mundane and transcendent aims, by teaching them the Dharma in general.

original: sems can so so la bye brag tu thabs bstan pa sngon du gtong ba'i rigs pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can so so la bye brag tu thabs bstan pa sngon du gtong ba'i rigs pa ston pa'o //
translated: They help those who are tormented by the suffering of confusion, not knowing the means for specific aims, by teaching them the means for specific aims.

original: phan 'dogs 'dogs pa'i sems can ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs 'dogs pa'i sems can ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Benefiting sentient beings is of four kinds:

original: lan du phan 'dogs su re ba de dag la ni byas pa gzo brjes su srung ba'i sgo nas mnyam pa'am lhag par lan du phan 'dogs pas nye bar gnas pa dang / 'jigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skrag pa de dag 'jigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs la skyob pa dang /
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs su re ba de dag la ni byas pa gzo brjes su srung ba'i sgo nas mnyam pa'am lhag par lan du phan 'dogs pas nye bar gnas pa dang / 'jigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis skrag pa de dag 'jigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs la skyob pa dang /

original: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de dag gi mya ngan gyi mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / yo byad kyis phongs pa de dag la yang rigs pas yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de dag gi mya ngan gyi mtshan nyid kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / yo byad kyis phongs pa de dag la yang rigs pas yo byad thams cad nye bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: They remove the suffering of sorrow of those who are suffering, and they provide all the necessities to those who are in need of necessities.

original: zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Those who have entered the Great Vehicle are of two kinds:ğŸ”½those who are dependent and those who are independent.

original: rten la rag las pa de dag la ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis rten sbyin pas tshogs yongs su sdud pa dang / chos mthun pa gzhan la mi rten pa de dag la ni so sor yang dag par dga' bar bya bas dus dus su thad du 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: rten la rag las pa de dag la ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis rten sbyin pas tshogs yongs su sdud pa dang / chos mthun pa gzhan la mi rten pa de dag la ni so sor yang dag par dga' bar bya bas dus dus su thad du 'gro ba dang /
translated: The bodhisattva gathers a group of the first by giving them a home out of a pure intention, and by going to them from time to time, he gladdens them individually.

analyzed: log par zhugs pa de dag la ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas tshar gcad par bya ba ste /

original: nyes pa chung ngu ni sma dbab pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bring la ni chad pa'i las byed du gzhug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chen po la ni bskrad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byed do //
analyzed: nyes pa chung ngu ni sma dbab pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bring la ni chad pa'i las byed du gzhug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chen po la ni bskrad pa'i mtshan nyid kyis byed do //
translated: One does this with a slight fault by the characteristic of a reprimand, with a middling fault by the characteristic of having them do a degrading job, and with a great fault by the characteristic of banishing them.

analyzed: tshar gcad par bya ba'i don dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to teach that the meaning of what is to be refuted is endowed with the meaning of what is to be refuted, it says, â€œIt is like this.â€ğŸ”½

translated: In order to teach the meaning of what is to be eliminated, he says, â€œIt is like this.â€ğŸ”½Hostility is twofold: those who engage in misdeeds are caused to be disgusted with nonvirtue by demonstrating the world of sentient beings who are connected with the suffering of various harms.

original: 'bring dang / chen po bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring dang / chen po bskyed pa'o //
translated: Those who engage in good deeds are caused to generate small, middling, and great joy by being inspired through the miraculous power of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims rnam pa gsum la gnas pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims rnam pa gsum la gnas pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the cause for the perfection of the three types of morality of the bodhisattva who abides in the three types of morality, he says, â€œthe morality of the bodhisattva vow,â€ and so on.

original: rnam pa bcus na legs par bsdoms pa'i tshul khrims can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus na legs par bsdoms pa'i tshul khrims can du 'gyur te /
translated: By ten aspects, one becomes one who has well-collected morality.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste ;
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste ;
translated: This means that oneâ€™s morality becomes completely pure and completely perfected.

original: 'das pa'i 'dod pa spangs pa rnams la lta ba'i srid pa kun du mi spyod pas mi lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa kun du mi spyod pas mi lta ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa rnams la lhag par zhen pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'dod pa spangs pa rnams la lta ba'i srid pa kun du mi spyod pas mi lta ba dang / ma 'ongs pa rnams la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa kun du mi spyod pas mi lta ba dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa rnams la lhag par zhen pa med pa dang /
translated: One does not look at the past objects of desire, because one does not engage in the existence of views. One does not look at the future, because one does not engage in the craving of delight. One does not have excessive attachment to the present objects of desire, because one does not engage in the craving of attachment.

original: lus dang sems dben pa dang / ngag dang rtog pa yongs su dag pa dang / bdag la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / shas cher nges pa dang / shes cher bzod pa dang / bag yod par gnas pa dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o //ğŸ”½phyag dar gyi 'du shes kyis yongs su spangs pa'i rtsva dang mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyi sa la ji ltar thams cad mi lta ba de bas ni byang chub sems dpa' ni rtsva dang ba'i 'dod pa rnams la snying po med pa'i
analyzed: lus dang sems dben pa dang / ngag dang rtog pa yongs su dag pa dang / bdag la khyad du mi gsod pa dang / shas cher nges pa dang / shes cher bzod pa dang / bag yod par gnas pa dang / cho ga dang 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'o // phyag dar gyi 'du shes kyis yongs su spangs pa'i rtsva dang mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis yongs su spangs pa'i phyi sa la ji ltar thams cad mi lta ba de bas ni byang chub sems dpa' ni rtsva dang ba'i 'dod pa rnams la snying po med pa'i
translated: physical and mental seclusion, purity of speech and thought, not disparaging oneself, being mostly resolute, being mostly patient, living heedfully, and purity of conduct and livelihood.ğŸ”½Just as one who has the idea of a piece of cloth does not look at discarded grass, and one who has the idea of filth does not look at discarded feces, so the bodhisattva does not look at the objects of desire, because they are like grass,

original: phyir / mi lta ba dang / phyi sa dang 'dra ba'i 'dod pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i phyi sa rul ba lta bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: phyir / mi lta ba dang / phyi sa dang 'dra ba'i 'dod pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i phyi sa rul ba lta bu dang 'brel pa'i phyir mi lta ba'o //
translated: because they are like feces, and because they are connected with the rotting filth of the addictions.

original: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung bas ji ltar 'dod pa thams cad spangs pa rnams la mi lta ba de bas ni byang chub sems dpa' mi'i 'dod pa'i mchog rnams la mi lta ba khyad par du byas nas /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung bas ji ltar 'dod pa thams cad spangs pa rnams la mi lta ba de bas ni byang chub sems dpa' mi'i 'dod pa'i mchog rnams la mi lta ba khyad par du byas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva's non-regard for the highest human enjoyments is especially great, compared to the non-regard of those gone forth who are motivated by the thought of livelihood, and who give up all that they desire.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'dod pa rnams la mi lta ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'dod pa rnams la mi lta ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, he does not regard the enjoyments of a world-emperor.

original: lha rdzas mchog gi dbang du byas nas bdud kyi gnas su gtogs pa'i 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lha rdzas mchog gi dbang du byas nas bdud kyi gnas su gtogs pa'i 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From the point of view of the highest divine enjoyments, it says, he does not regard the enjoyments that belong to the abode of Mara.

original: dper na 'jigs pa chen po sna tshogs kyis gang zhing zing par 'jug pa ni gnod pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'jigs pa chen po sna tshogs kyis gang zhing zing par 'jug pa ni gnod pa'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: For example, a place that is filled with various great dangers and is a source of harm, is not able to be enjoyed.

original: thar bar bya ba mi nus pa de bzhin du 'dod pa rnams la yang dag par mthong na mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: thar bar bya ba mi nus pa de bzhin du 'dod pa rnams la yang dag par mthong na mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur ro//
translated: In the same way, when one sees enjoyments as they really are, one does not delight in them.

original: @155a * // rnyed pa dang bkur sti rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: @155a * // rnyed pa dang bkur sti rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because he is free from the craving and passion for gain and honor, it says, he does not regard the enjoyments of the gods.

original: kha zas kyi skyugs pa dang 'dra bar shes rab kyis yang dag bar mthong na lhag par zhen pa med cing ro myong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: kha zas kyi skyugs pa dang 'dra bar shes rab kyis yang dag bar mthong na lhag par zhen pa med cing ro myong bar mi byed do //
translated: When one sees with wisdom that they are like vomit, one has no special attachment to them and does not savor them.

original: rab tu dben par mngon par dga' ba yin te zhes bya ba ni lus dpen par gyur pa ste ;
analyzed: rab tu dben par mngon par dga' ba yin te zhes bya ba ni lus dpen par gyur pa ste ;
translated: He delights in solitude. His body is secluded.

original: de bas na gcig pu zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bas na gcig pu zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be alone.

original: tshogs kyi nang na 'dug kyang sems dben par gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang na 'dug kyang sems dben par gyur te /
translated: Even when he is in the midst of a group, his mind is secluded.

original: tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin gyi de nyid la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med par mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin gyi de nyid la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med par mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
translated: He does not consider mere morality to be sufficient, but rather, on that basis, he strives to accomplish the immeasurable meditative concentrations of the bodhisattvas and to attain mastery over them.

original: ngan pa'i gtam zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam mo //
analyzed: ngan pa'i gtam zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam mo //
translated: Bad speech is afflicted speech.

original: ngan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni de nyid rnam grangs kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni de nyid rnam grangs kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o //
translated: Bad words are the same, but are taught by way of synonyms.

original: dang du len par mi byed ces bya ba ni mi smra ba ste /
analyzed: dang du len par mi byed ces bya ba ni mi smra ba ste /
translated: He does not tolerate it means he does not speak.

original: mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: â€œI will not do it.â€

original: brgya la brgya lam na yang brjed ngas pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa ngan pa cung zad kyang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: brgya la brgya lam na yang brjed ngas pas 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa ngan pa cung zad kyang mi bskyed do //
translated: Even if he should forget, he will not generate even a little bad thought, such as the thought of sensual desire.

original: skyes par gyur na yang 'gyod pa dang nyes dmigs su lta ste /
analyzed: skyes par gyur na yang 'gyod pa dang nyes dmigs su lta ste /
translated: And if he should generate such a thought, he will look at it with regret and with the idea of the disadvantages.

original: de dag gnyi ga kun du mi spyod par dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga kun du mi spyod par dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: He will not indulge in either of them, and mindfulness will be present.

original: mi bya ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni mi bya ba'i blo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bya ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni mi bya ba'i blo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the thought of not doing is the very thought of not doing.

original: sems gang gis skyes pa de 'dor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems gang gis skyes pa de 'dor bar 'gyur te /
translated: The thought by which he gives up the thought of doing.

original: 'dor ba la goms na kun du mi spyod pa la dga' ba dang / kun du spyod pa dang mi mthun bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'dor ba la goms na kun du mi spyod pa la dga' ba dang / kun du spyod pa dang mi mthun bar gnas so //
translated: When he is accustomed to giving it up, he delights in not indulging in it, and he abides in the opposite of indulgence.

original: dge ba sdud pa rnams dang sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam ni yangs shing rgyas pa'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa rnams dang sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam ni yangs shing rgyas pa'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
translated: The morality of gathering virtue and of working for the benefit of sentient beings is vast because it is extensive.

original: gzhi'i sgo nas tshad gzung mi nus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i sgo nas tshad gzung mi nus pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it cannot be measured by a basis.

original: rtog pa'i yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it transcends all objects of thought.

original: yun mi thung bar bzhugs pa'i phyir yun ring du lon pa'o //
analyzed: yun mi thung bar bzhugs pa'i phyir yun ring du lon pa'o //
translated: It is long-lasting because it endures for a long time.

original: gzhan dag gis bya mi nus pa'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bya mi nus pa'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is supreme joy because it cannot be done by others.

original: skrag pa ni 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: skrag pa ni 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fear is terror.

original: zhum pa ni bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: zhum pa ni bag tsha ba'o //
translated: Timidity is anxiety.

original: 'gong ba ni bdag gis mi nus kyang srid do snyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gong ba ni bdag gis mi nus kyang srid do snyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Discouragement is the thought, â€œI may not be able to do it.â€

original: spro ba kho na bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spro ba kho na bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate just enthusiasm,

original: de dag kyang mir gyur pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mir gyur pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, â€œThey are human beings, etc.â€

original: bdag gi nyes pa dang gzhan la gnod pa'i 'khrul pa la rtog par byed kyi gzhan dag la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed pas ni nges pa bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gi nyes pa dang gzhan la gnod pa'i 'khrul pa la rtog par byed kyi gzhan dag la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed pas ni nges pa bstan to //
translated: He shows certainty by saying, â€œThey do not generate suffering in others, but rather consider their own faults and the errors of harming others.â€

original: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la @155b sems mi 'khrugs pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pas ni bzod pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la @155b sems mi 'khrugs pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pas ni bzod pa bstan to //
translated: The absence of mental disturbance with regard to the harm inflicted by others, the absence of retaliation for harm inflicted by others, and the absence of violence are taught as patience.

original: phyir rdeg pa ni lus kyis te /
analyzed: phyir rdeg pa ni lus kyis te /
translated: Retaliation is by way of the body.

original: gnod pa byas pa dag la sems kyis kyang sdang bar mi byed na zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byas pa dag la sems kyis kyang sdang bar mi byed na zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: One should connect this with the absence of mental hostility toward those who inflict harm.

original: 'das pa'i nyes pa so sor 'chags pa'i phyir ni sngon gyi mtha' dad ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i nyes pa so sor 'chags pa'i phyir ni sngon gyi mtha' dad ldan pa'o //
translated: The beginning is connected with the confession of past faults.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pa la de ltar nan tan byed pas na phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pa la de ltar nan tan byed pas na phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The end is connected with the future, since one practices in that way with regard to future faults.

original: da ltar byung ba'i nyes pa mi brjod pa'i phyir na dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i nyes pa mi brjod pa'i phyir na dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The middle is connected with the present, since one does not mention present faults.

original: so sor brtags nas kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang ngag gi las la 'jug pa'i phyir ni snga nas bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang ngag gi las la 'jug pa'i phyir ni snga nas bya ba'o //
translated: The prior is connected with the practice of wholesome actions of body and speech, since one engages in them after careful consideration.

original: de ltar so sor rtog pa ni de kho na bzhin du spyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ni lhan cig rjes su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog pa ni de kho na bzhin du spyod pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ni lhan cig rjes su spyod pa'o //
translated: Thus, discernment is the practice of the same reality, and so it is the practice of the same objective support.

original: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the point of view of the perfection of ritual,

original: dge ba mi spyoms shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge ba mi spyoms shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he does not advertise his virtues, etc.

original: grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bzod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: He is indifferent to suffering because he endures the suffering of cold, etc.

original: ma rnyed pas yid mi bde ba med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: ma rnyed pas yid mi bde ba med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: He is not tormented because he is not unhappy about not getting something.

original: dbang po dul zhing zhi ba'i phyir rgod pa med pa dang / yeng yeng po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dul zhing zhi ba'i phyir rgod pa med pa dang / yeng yeng po ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is not agitated and is not distracted because his faculties are subdued and calm.

original: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul 'chos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul 'chos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: From the point of view of the perfection of livelihood, he does not deceive with a show of honesty, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon par sgrub pa la ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang du mi len pa'i phyir dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon par sgrub pa la ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang du mi len pa'i phyir dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The morality of gathering virtue is presented as the avoidance of taking up the resistances, since one avoids the resistances by means of accomplishing the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po lnga kho nar nges pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po lnga kho nar nges pa'o //
translated: The resistances to the five perfections are definitely only the five resistances to the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is fivefold:

original: de lta na de dag gi nyen por gyur pa rnam pa bcus de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba dpag tu med pa myur du sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de dag gi nyen por gyur pa rnam pa bcus de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba dpag tu med pa myur du sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by means of the ten resistances and their antidotes, the bodhisattva who is established in the perfections quickly gathers immeasurable virtue.

original: lus dang longs spyod la lhag par zhen na lus dang longs spyod la lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod la lhag par zhen na lus dang longs spyod la lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is attached to body and possessions, one views them as oneâ€™s own.

original: lta ba yod na yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: lta ba yod na yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: If there is the view of self, there is no relinquishment.

original: de lta bas na de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the resistance to the perfection of generosity.

original: de dang du len par mi byed na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang du len par mi byed na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one does not accept them, the perfection of giving is accomplished.

original: 'chal ba'i khrims kyi gzhi dang du ma blangs pas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @156a * //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i khrims kyi gzhi dang du ma blangs pas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu @156a * //
translated: The perfection of morality is from not accepting the basis of immorality.

original: phyin pa'o // sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems mi skyed pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa'o // sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems mi skyed pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is from not generating malice towards sentient beings.

original: gnyid log pa'i bde ba'i dbang du byas te le lo mi bsten pas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid log pa'i bde ba'i dbang du byas te le lo mi bsten pas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is from not relying on laziness, taking the pleasure of sleep as the basis.

original: bsam gtan gyis pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skyed pas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis pa'i nyon mongs pa mi skyed pas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is from not generating the afflictions of the meditative stabilizations.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal ba'i shes rab rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal ba'i shes rab rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five types of bad wisdom are the resistances to the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon rab tu mi shes pa dang / dge ba'i rgyu rab tu mi shes pa dang / 'bras bu la phyin ci log tu kun du spyod pa dang / phyin ci log gi gnyen po rab tu mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon rab tu mi shes pa dang / dge ba'i rgyu rab tu mi shes pa dang / 'bras bu la phyin ci log tu kun du spyod pa dang / phyin ci log gi gnyen po rab tu mi shes pa dang /
translated: Not knowing the benefits of the result of merit, not knowing the cause of virtue, engaging in error with regard to the result, not knowing the antidote to error,

original: dge ba'i chos la bar du gcod pa rab tu mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la bar du gcod pa rab tu mi shes pa'o //
translated: and not knowing the obstacles to virtuous dharmas.

original: de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa'i gnas lnga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas dge ba sdud par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa'i gnas lnga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas dge ba sdud par bstan to //
translated: The five topics that are their antidotes are taught as the virtue of gathering through the perfection of wisdom by way of accomplishing it in accordance with reality.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa bcu gcig ni sems can rnam pa bcu gcig yod pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam pa bcu gcig ni sems can rnam pa bcu gcig yod pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The morality of working for the welfare of sentient beings is presented from the perspective of the eleven types of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad ni bsdus nas yongs su bcad pa rnam pa bcu gcig gis rnam par bzhag nas de dang 'tsham pa'i don bya ba'i rjes su 'brang bas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa re re la yang dpag tu med par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni bsdus nas yongs su bcad pa rnam pa bcu gcig gis rnam par bzhag nas de dang 'tsham pa'i don bya ba'i rjes su 'brang bas sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ba dang / rnam pa re re la yang dpag tu med par rig par bya'o /
translated: And each of these categories should be understood as being immeasurable.

original: sems can rnam pa bcu gcig po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can rnam pa bcu gcig po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eleven categories of sentient beings?

original: bya ba de dang de dag la grogs byed de /
analyzed: bya ba de dang de dag la grogs byed de /
translated: They are those who are friends in this and that activity,

original: de 'dod pa rnams dang sdug bsngal zhing rigs pa la rmongs te de 'dod pa rnams dang / phan 'dogs 'dod pas phyir lan du phan 'dogs par 'dod pa rnams dang / 'jig rten skyabs 'dod pa rnams dang / phongs par gyur pa dang / mya ngan gyis gzir ba dang /
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams dang sdug bsngal zhing rigs pa la rmongs te de 'dod pa rnams dang / phan 'dogs 'dod pas phyir lan du phan 'dogs par 'dod pa rnams dang / 'jig rten skyabs 'dod pa rnams dang / phongs par gyur pa dang / mya ngan gyis gzir ba dang /
translated: those who are friends in the practice of virtue, those who are friends in the practice of evil, those who are friends in the practice of both virtue and evil, those who are friends in the practice of neither virtue nor evil, those who are friends in the practice of the perfections, those who are friends in the practice of the factors of enlightenment, those who are friends in the practice of the factors of the path, those who are friends in the practice of the results of the path, those who are friends in the practice of the vehicles, and those who are friends in the practice of the vehicles of the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yo byad med de de 'dod pa rnams dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma la rten 'cha' bar 'dod pa rnams dang / yongs su 'dzin pas gnas pa rnams dang / mthun par byed pa'i sems dang / mthun par bya bas 'dul ba rnams dang /
analyzed: yo byad med de de 'dod pa rnams dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dang bla ma la rten 'cha' bar 'dod pa rnams dang / yongs su 'dzin pas gnas pa rnams dang / mthun par byed pa'i sems dang / mthun par bya bas 'dul ba rnams dang /
translated: Those who are without material goods and desire them, those who desire to rely on preceptors, instructors, and gurus, those who live with possessions, those who have a mind to be harmonious, those who are disciplined by being harmonious,

original: yang dag pa dang log par zhugs pa rnams dang bsdu ba dang tshar bcad par 'os pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhe 'gras pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang log par zhugs pa rnams dang bsdu ba dang tshar bcad par 'os pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhe 'gras pa rnams so //
translated: those who are engaged in the correct and incorrect, those who are suitable to be gathered and defeated, and those who are hostile to the teachings of the TathÄgata.

original: grogs @156b byed pa ni so sor phye na bya ba dang mi bya ba rnams la grogs byed pa rnam pa brgyad yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: grogs @156b byed pa ni so sor phye na bya ba dang mi bya ba rnams la grogs byed pa rnam pa brgyad yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Regarding assistance, when divided, there are eight types of assistance in regard to what should be done and what should not be done.

original: bya ba dang mi bya ba brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bya ba dang mi bya ba brtag pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The investigation of what should be done and what should not be done is as follows.

original: bya ba sems pa zhes bya ba smos pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba sems pa zhes bya ba smos pa ste /
translated: It is said, The intention to do what should be done.

original: gang du byas pa dang ma byas pa las 'byor pa dang rgud par gyur par mthong nas de la sems pa'o /
analyzed: gang du byas pa dang ma byas pa las 'byor pa dang rgud par gyur par mthong nas de la sems pa'o /
translated: Having seen that wealth and poverty come from what has been done and what has not been done, one thinks about that.

original: de ltar byung ba'i dus nas gzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i dus nas gzung ste /
translated: From the time that this occurs,

original: bya ba gdon mi za bar nges par 'dzin pa ni bya ba gtan la 'bebs pa'o /
analyzed: bya ba gdon mi za bar nges par 'dzin pa ni bya ba gtan la 'bebs pa'o /
translated: the determination to do what must be done is the determination of the task.

original: de dag gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir de dang der grogs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir de dang der grogs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: In order to show both of these, he says, â€œin each case, it is the companion.â€

original: lam du 'gro ba 'dron  po med pa'am /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba 'dron  po med pa'am /
translated: The companion is for those who go on the path without a caravan,ğŸ”½or without followers, and for those who are engaged in the performance of a task begun with reason, and so on.

original: phyi bzhin du 'brang ba med pa rnams la grogs su 'gro ba dang / rigs pas brtsam pa'i bya ba la sogs pa las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba dag pa dang / longs spyod bsgrubs pa bsrung ba dang / sems can phan tshun bye ba sdums pa dang /
analyzed: phyi bzhin du 'brang ba med pa rnams la grogs su 'gro ba dang / rigs pas brtsam pa'i bya ba la sogs pa las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba dag pa dang / longs spyod bsgrubs pa bsrung ba dang / sems can phan tshun bye ba sdums pa dang /
translated: The companion is for those who have attained enjoyments and wish to protect them, for those who wish to reconcile beings who are divided,

original: nyi ma nges par bsod nams kyi khyad par myong bar 'gro ba'i dus dang / bsod nams rtsom pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: nyi ma nges par bsod nams kyi khyad par myong bar 'gro ba'i dus dang / bsod nams rtsom pa'i dus na'o //
translated: and for those who wish to experience the special merit of the day, and for those who wish to create merit.

original: sems can rnams ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis kyis sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis kyis sdug bsngal te /
translated: Beings are miserable because of the two kinds of suffering, that of the body and that of the mind.

original: lus kyi rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four kinds of bodily suffering are:

original: nad kyi sdug bsngal dang / dbang po nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yan lag med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / ngal ba dang dub pa'i sdug bsngal lo //ğŸ”½sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: nad kyi sdug bsngal dang / dbang po nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yan lag med pa'i sdug bsngal dang / ngal ba dang dub pa'i sdug bsngal lo // sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: the suffering of disease, the suffering of the degeneration of faculties, the suffering of being incomplete in limbs or organs, and the suffering of fatigue.

original: sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal ba yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The suffering of the mind is also suffering because it is the cause of suffering.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
